column4: Apple says never worked with NSA on iPhone hacks
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc has never worked with the U.S. National Security Agency and is unaware of efforts to target its smartphones  the company said in response to reports that the spy agency had developed a system to hack into and monitor iPhones.

column4: UPDATE 1-Apple says never worked with NSA on iPhone backdoors

column4: Apple says has never worked with NSA on iPhone backdoors
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Dec 31 Apple Inc  responded on Tuesday to reports that the National Security Agency had developed a system to hack into and monitor iPhones called "Dropout Jeep " saying it never worked with the U.S. spy agency and was unaware of efforts to target its smartphones.

column4: Justice Department defends Apple monitor in e-books case
column5: NEW YORK A bitter battle between Apple Inc and a lawyer appointed to monitor its compliance with a court antitrust ruling escalated on Monday  as the U.S. government and the monitor both hit back at Apple.

column4: Netflix hikes CEO salary by 50 percent for 2014
column5: Netflix Inc raised the salary of its Chief Executive Reed Hastings by 50 percent to $6 million for 2014  a regulatory filing showed  as its stock quadrupled in value this year amidst new programming and a growth in subscriber base.

column5: NEW YORK  Dec 31 U.S. stocks advanced modestly on Tuesday  boosted by a solid consumer confidence reading  keeping the S&P 500 on track for its best year since 1997 and the Dow on pace to record its best performance since 1995.

column5: MEXICO CITY Latin American phone giant America Movil spent $5.4 billion this year propping up its share price and more buybacks are likely with new regulation and lingering uncertainty over its money-losing European investments  analysts said.

column4: Boeing tells state leaders 777X wing plant is at risk
column5: OLYMPIA  Washington Boeing Co  will not build the wing for its new 777X jetliner in Washington state if members of its largest union reject its latest contract offer in a Friday vote  company executives told Seattle-area elected officials on Monday.

column4: Boeing tells state leaders 777X wing plant is at risk
column5: OLYMPIA  Wash.  Dec 30 Boeing Co will not build the wing for its new 777X jetliner in Washington state if members of its largest union reject its latest contract offer in a Friday vote  company executives told Seattle-area elected officials on Monday.

column4: Cohen's SAC ends life as hedge fund with double-digit returns
column5: BOSTON Billionaire investor Steven A. Cohen's SAC Capital Advisors is ending its life as a hedge fund with a 20.10 percent gain this year  marking one of the industry's best returns even after SAC pleaded guilty to insider trading charges  a source familiar with the numbers said.

column4: Apollo's failed deal for Cooper sows doubt on future Indian M&A
column5: MUMBAI The ambition from Indian mid-sized companies for large debt-fuelled acquisitions abroad was dealt a major setback after the unraveling of a $2.5 billion bid by India's Apollo Tyres Ltd  to buy Cooper Tire & Rubber Co .

column4: PRESS DIGEST - Wall Street Journal - Dec 31
column5: Dec 31 The following are the top stories in the Wall Street Journal. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

column4: Hewlett-Packard to cut 5 000 more jobs
column5: Hewlett-Packard Co said it would cut 5 000 more jobs  bringing the total number of layoffs to 34 000  or 11 percent of its workforce.

column4: Russia's debt-laden Mechel replaces CEO
column5: MOSCOW  Dec 31 Loss-making Russian coal miner and steelmaker Mechel  has appointed Oleg Korzhov  its senior vice-president for economics and management  as chief executive replacing Evgeny Mikhel  who had been CEO since 2010.

column4: Special Report: Lost hooves  dead cattle before Merck halted Zilmax sales
column5: WALLA WALLA COUNTY  WASHINGTON The U.S. beef industry's dependence on the muscle-building drug Zilmax began unraveling here  on a sweltering summer day  in the dusty cattle pens outside a Tyson Foods Inc slaughterhouse in southeastern Washington state.

column4: Greece's NBG sheds 20 pct of workforce to squeeze costs
column5: ATHENS  Dec 31 Greece's biggest lender National Bank (NBG) will axe about 20 percent of its workforce through a voluntary exit plan  becoming the latest lender to cut jobs as the sector restructures after years of crisis.

column4: Investors exercise fraction of Greece's National Bank warrants
column5: ATHENS  Dec 31 Investors exercised only a fraction of National Bank's (NBG) warrants to buy shares in Greece's largest lender from the country's bank rescue fund because the current share price was too low.

column4: Nasdaq to acquire 5 percent in Borsa Istanbul
column5: ISTANBUL Nasdaq OMX Group  will take a 5 percent stake in Turkey's Borsa Istanbul in a tie-up that will allow the Turkish exchange to use Nasdaq's market technologies to attract new customers  the two exchanges said on Tuesday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Chinese recycling tycoon says he wants to buy New York Times
column5: BEIJING  Dec 31 An eccentric Chinese recycling magnate said on Tuesday he was preparing to open negotiations to buy the New York Times Co.

column4: China halts imports of Pfizer drug on paperwork glitch
column5: SHANGHAI China suspended imports of U.S. drugmaker Pfizer Inc's AIDS-related drug Diflucan on Tuesday  citing a problem with late paperwork  the country's food and drug watchdog said in a statement on its website.

column4: Cosmetics maker Revlon to exit China
column5: Revlon Inc  said it would exit China  where sales of its cosmetics have been falling  and cut more than 1 000 jobs as part of a restructuring designed to save about $11 million a year.

column5: * Expects annual savings of about $11 mln from the restructuring

column4: Cosmetics maker Revlon to exit China
column5: Dec 31 Cosmetics maker Revlon Inc  known for its Almay and Sinful Colors brands  said it would exit its China operations as part of a restructuring that would save about $11 million annually.

column4: U.S. judge releases dying lawyer convicted of aiding terrorism
column5: NEW YORK A federal judge on Tuesday granted Lynne Stewart  a former defense lawyer convicted of aiding terrorism  a "compassionate" release from prison because she is dying of cancer.

column4: UPDATE 1-Stryker to buy Patient Safety Technologies for $120 mln
column5: Dec 31 Stryker Corp said it would buy Patient Safety Technologies Inc for $120 million  adding to its portfolio a device that reduces the risk of surgical sponges being left in patients after surgery.

column4: Stryker to buy Patient Safety Technologies for $120 million
column5: Stryker Corp  said it would buy Patient Safety Technologies Inc  for $120 million to gain access to Patient Safety's device to reduce the risk of surgical sponges being left in patients after surgery.

column4: Target faces problems with gift cards sold over holidays
column5: NEW YORK Target Corp  which is dealing with one of the largest ever payment-data breaches in U.S. retail history  said on Tuesday that some of the gift cards it sold over the holiday season were not activated properly.

column4: U.S. consumer mood brightens  but home price gains slow
column5: NEW YORK U.S. consumers' mood improved as 2013 drew to a close  with many optimistic about their future job prospects  while home prices rose again in October  though the pace of gains slowed.
